intro: Vincetoxicum lasiostomum, commonly known as the red baneberry, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to eastern North America. It belongs to the Berberidaceae family and is characterized by its striking, clustered inflorescences of white flowers that develop into bright red berries. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded woodlands and has attractive, heart-shaped leaves with a velvety texture. Its berries are toxic to humans and animals, containing compounds that can cause severe gastrointestinal distress. Despite its toxicity, it is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens.
